title: Dozens of countries back International Criminal Court after Trump sanctions
description: A majority of member states, including the UK, Germany and France, said the court was "vital" for international justice.

title: Hamas names next hostages to be released
description: The three civilians will be exchanged for more Palestinian prisoners in the latest swap on Saturday.

title: Sweden plans tighter gun laws after deadly school shooting
description: Police confirm seven women and three men - aged between 28 and 68 - were killed in the country's worst mass shooting.

title: Sudan army makes huge gains as it seeks to recapture war-torn capital
description: "Shrapnel and stray ammunition are falling on my neighbourhood," a doctor tells the BBC.

title: Sexual violence against children in Haiti rises by 1,000%, UN says
description: Unicef says gangs are inflicting "unimaginable horrors on children".

title: New allegations Diddy sexually assaulted minor in nightclub
description: Combs has consistently denied the allegations against him in civil lawsuits, labelling them "sickening".

title: Sweden's worst mass shooting leaves immigrant community on edge
description: Among the dead in Sweden's first school shooting were Syrians and Bosnians.

title: USAID could slash staff to hundreds after placing most on leave
description: But US President Donald Trump's plan to dramatically cut back US foreign aid faces a legal challenge.

title: Japan's PM to seek 'personal relationship' with Trump
description: Shared concerns about North Korea are likely to be a primary topic, along with economic ties.

title: Venezuela calls US seizure of plane 'brazen theft'
description: The US says the Venezuelan aircraft was involved in violations of US export control and sanctions laws.

title: Argentina canal turns bright red, alarming residents
description: Pictures and videos show the intensely coloured water flowing into an estuary, the Rio de la Plata.

title: British conman jailed for six years for running over French policemen
description: The French prosecutor said he had turned a rural area into a "bewildering scene worthy of Mad Max".

title: Alaska authorities search for missing small plane
description: The aircraft carrying 10 people was on flight from Unalakleet to Nome when "its position was lost".

title: US job growth slows but unemployment stays low
description: Firms created 143,000 jobs last month, below analysts' forecasts, but December's figure was upgraded.

title: Jailed Singapore ex-minister moved to house arrest
description: Subramaniam Iswaran's case gripped the island nation that prides itself with its squeaky clean image.

title: More than 100 venomous snakes found in Sydney yard
description: Reptile handlers say they initially found 40 red-bellied black snakes - before some began giving birth.

title: Man launches fight against fine for loudspeaker call at French station
description: The outraged passenger hires a lawyer to dispute the fine over a public phone call in Nantes.

title: Spanish footballer was 'overwhelmed' after World Cup kiss, court hears
description: Teammates of Jenni Hermoso have testified in a trial over a kiss between her and former football chief Luis Rubiales.

title: Judge halts Trump's government worker buyout plan
description: The offer is part of an ongoing effort by the Trump administration to slash the size of the federal government.

title: Trump says Israel will hand over Gaza to US after fighting ends
description: The president reiterates that the idea would mean resettling Palestinians, and that no US soldiers would be needed.

title: Israeli soldier jailed for abusing Palestinian detainees from Gaza
description: Israel's military says he punched detainees and used his weapon while they were handcuffed and blindfolded.

title: Spyware firm cuts Italy access after alleged targeting of activists - reports
description: WhatsApp alleged last week that Paragon Solutions spyware was used to target users of the messaging app in two dozen countries.

title: State of emergency declared for Santorini after quakes
description: More than 11,000 people have already left the island of Santorini following a series of tremors in recent days.

title: Record January warmth puzzles climate scientists
description: January was expected to be cooler than the same month last year, but was 0.1C warmer, which experts are struggling to explain.

title: Mandatory jail for Nazi salutes under new Australia laws
description: The new laws come amid a wave of high profile antisemitic attacks which have become a heated topic of debate.

title: Panama denies US claims over free canal passages
description: Washington had suggested Panama had agreed to no longer charge fees for US government vessels using the waterway.

title: More than 100 women raped and burned alive in DR Congo jailbreak, UN says
description: As M23 rebels entered Goma and the city was plunged into chaos, female prisoners were attacked, the UN says.

title: Jeremy Bowen: Trump's Gaza plan won't happen, but it will have consequences
description: The US president creates uncertainty and injects more instability, our international editor writes.

title: BBC Verify: Can Trump really take ownership of Gaza?
description: BBC Verify examines international law to understand if the US has the authority to "take over" the Gaza Strip.

title: 'We won't go out of Gaza': Palestinians express shock and defiance at Trump plan
description: Palestinians are calling on Jordan and Egypt to hold out against US pressure to take in displaced Gazans.

title: Why does Trump want to take over Gaza and could he do it?
description: The president's vision for a Gaza under US control could upend the future of Middle East relations.

title: Analysis: Trump's real-estate instincts clash with his America First worldview
description: This isn't the first time he has seen a foreign policy problem as a business opportunity, writes Anthony Zurcher.

title: Gaza in maps: How 15 months of war have drastically changed the territory
description: A visual guide to how much has changed in the Gaza Strip since Israel began its military response to Hamas's attacks on 7 October.

title: History of the conflict explained
description: The conflict between Israel and the Palestinian people is one of the longest-running in the world.

title: Casinos, high-rises and fraud: The BBC visits a bizarre city built on scams
description: A haven for the super rich, or a city built on scams? The BBC was invited to find out.

title: Stylish earrings to gold shoes on show at South Africa's biggest political event
description: A collection of some of the best outfits from the State of the Nation Address.

title: How long could the Santorini 'seismic crisis' last?
description: Scientists say it is unclear how many more earthquakes will come to the idyllic Greek island.

title: Why Trump is on the warpath in Somalia
description: Militants in the mountains of north-eastern Somalia have become the beating heart of Islamic State in Africa.

title: Oscar-nominated West Bank feature director says films 'can be part of change'
description: The film by a Israeli-Palestinian group follows the fight over home demolitions by the Israeli army.

title: 'Studio sex' and 'hitman threats': Insiders speak out about Diddy's 90s music empire
description: Bad Boy Records staff claim troubling incidents in the rise of the rap mogul, now fighting sex trafficking charges.

title: 'I'm alive thanks to US foreign aid'
description: The BBC speaks to people around the world who will be affected if Donald Trump shuts the US's main overseas aid agency.

title: 'People seem dumbstruck' - Inside Musk's race to upend government
description: The world's richest man has emerged as a dominant force in Trump's second term, gutting an agency and issuing ultimatums to staff.

title: What do we know about the Sweden school shooter?
description: Local media suggest the 35-year-old legally owned a weapon, was unemployed and had no convictions.

title: Johannesburg revival: Bringing hope to one of world's most dangerous cities
description: Johannesburg is known as a dangerous city, but some people are working to change that reputation.

title: First glimpse inside burnt scroll after 2,000 years
description: The document charred by the eruption of Mount Vesuvius is being 'unwrapped' using X-ray scans and AI.

title: Mosul's landmarks rise again after IS destruction
description: Some 80% of the Old City of Mosul, in northern Iraq, was destroyed under the Islamic State group.

title: Ghana wants more for its cashews, but it's a tough nut to crack
description: The African nation exports its cashews in raw form, but processing them would be more lucrative.

title: Watch: Passenger train engulfed by flames in Pennsylvania
description: More than 300 people were safely evacuated after a fire started under the first car of the train.

title: Watch horseback police chase after suspected drug dealer
description: Mounted police galloped after a man who fled on foot when officers approached him in Jacksonville, Florida.

title: Plane crashes into bus on busy São Paulo street
description: Two people were killed in the accident, the Brazilian city's fire department said.

title: Watch: Argentina canal turns bright red, alarming locals
description: The body of water runs through industrial areas on the outskirts of Buenos Aires.

title: False video claims Hollywood stars were paid by USAID to visit Ukraine
description: The video has hallmarks of a Russian disinformation operation, previously investigated by the BBC.
